reviewText: I remember watching this film as a child and thinking that it moved a bit slow, especially when compared to the Rankin & Bass Christmas specials. Unlike R & B specials it has no evil villain to fear or hero to cheer for. The songs were not as catchy either.However, now as an adult I seem to enjoy the laid back simple story. The songs are good and I like the introduction and ending with live actors. I think what makes me appreciate this special even more are the so called Christmas specials that are produced today. I have children of my own now and neither they or I like what we see today. Thankfully they also like the Christmas specials I remember from my childhood.This Christmas special is not aired that often anymore and it seems to drift in and out of availability for DVD and VHS purchase. If you see that it is airing on television you may want to record it as it hard to come by these days.
summary: This Christmas special gets better and better with age!

reviewText: My late Uncle Gabriel took my siblings and myself to see this at a Saturday morning matinee back in the 1970s.  It was a crowded theater lobby and my sister was crabby.  But, once inside the theater, we were taken away to a western forest and introduced to a family of bears and a kind ranger.  I was hooked by the story.  This animated movie is a favorite of mine for so many reasons.  Yes, the animation is only good but the enchanting tale of believing in Santa Claus and love is whimsical and heartwarming.  The characters are easy to relate to and the feeling of a simple time and message comes forth.  I still get that feeling when I watch it.  Watch it once and you will see what I mean.
summary: A simple Christmas tale of love and believing in Santa Claus
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a favorite audio story and book for our son when he was a toddler.  When I saw it was available on DVD I wanted to order it for him to share with his three little ones.  The audio required imagination and the video was just okay quality (copied from VHS?), but wasn't quite the way I envisioned the story - since everyone has their own imagination.  Cute for young children who are not as particular about sound and picture quality.

reviewerName: Kimi "'Oh, Christmas isn't just a day, it's a...
reviewText: They really don't make Christmas specials like they used to!  I grew up watching the Rankin & Bass classics, Charlie Brown and the Grinch, but didn't see this gem till I was easily into my 20s.  It took that one viewing to make me a fan that watches this every Christmas season as well as whenever I need a little 'comfort'.Ranger Smith has checked on a family of bears, Nana, Shinook and Nakomi, before the snow flies at Yellowstone National Park.  The two cubs, Nakomi and Shinook want to see what the Christmas holiday is all about, seeing how they hibernate through the holiday, as a rule.  The special shows Ranger Smith trying to explain the legend of Santa Claus and Nana trying to get her two cubs in the cave, so they will settle down and she can sleep, too.The animation is excellent, the songs catchy and the story, fun.  I've had several VHS copies as well as several DVD copies and no two seem to be the same.  You can find a short live-action sequence at the beginning and end of some copies or you may just find a complete animated version.  Picture/sound quality also varies, but I can honestly say, the quailty is never too bad to keep you from enjoying this classic.  My advice, check this out, it's so worth it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: THIS A CHRISTMAS CLASSIC THAT ISN'T ALWAYS SHOWN ON TV.  IT'S FOR CHILDREN OF ALL AGES AND THAT ALSO INCLUDES ADULTS.  ALL THE CHARACTERS ARE GREAT.  THE PARK RANGER TELLS THE BEAR CUBS ABOUT SANTA CLAUS.  THEY IN TURN TELL THEIR MOTHER WHO IS READY FOR A LONG WINTER NAP.  THE CUBS KEEP MOM UP AND THERE IS NO PEACE IN SIGHT.  IT'S A WONDERFUL STORY AND A KEEPER THRU THE YEARS.

reviewText: I don't know how they are getting away with this, but it's not a real DVD.  It's a cheesy copy in a poorly made case and laughable art.  The thing skips and when you finally get it working, you notice the entire section with the real Ranger is missing and the end is cut short, with sections just gone.  The release is inexcusable.  It's a film in public domain, so that means anyone can release it I guess.  But this is just obnoxious and an insult.
summary: Beware! Horrible DVDR (copy) missing scenes and poor quality.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A very sweet tale to watch during the Christmas Holiday.THE STORY: A Park Ranger tells two baby bear cubs all about Santa Claus. The cubs are very excited and want to have Christmas in their cave, but it is time to hibernate. Momma Bear wants wants peace and quiet in order to begin the long winter hibernation. The Ranger feels bad about getting their hopes up, and tries to make things right, but the real Santa would never let the bears down, would he?This is a great show from 1970. It was written and directed by Tony Benedict, art direction by Walt Peragoy. Voices include Hal Smith. It is a full length movie, at 76 minutes, so you get your money's worth here. The animation is soft and very charming, well done for it's time.
summary: Wonderful show, over an hour, and finally available again.

reviewText: A very old Christmas cartoon.  This was sent, as a surprise, to my adult daughter.  Needless to say - she called when she received it - excited and elated.The best part of the cartoon is when the voice-over asks "Do you belive in Santa Claus?"  Sit the kids on the floor in front of you and watch the nods of the heads.  Worth the price of admission.Great cartoon for todays kids -- makes even the grown up kids little ones again.A must have.
summary: Mr. Ranger and the 3 Bears Christmas

reviewText: I loved this cartoon growing up. It was a family staple at the holidays. This show would air every year during the Thanksgiving Holiday weekend right before the Hollywood Christmas Parade and after Yogi's First Christmas. It is too bad that you can only find the full version online and not on DVD. I would love to see this restored and put onto a  disc. It is a good story, clean and friendly for all ages 0-100. It is much better than most of the garbage they pass as family entertainment.
